intro: Hieracium zebrinum, commonly known as the zebra dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, it thrives in dry, sunny habitats. The plant produces a capsule that contains numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by the wind. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in some agricultural areas.
